p: Equally valuable is to compare the rate of response of the scientific community to the rate of epidemic growth. As a case study, we chose to compare data on SARS to that of SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19). Interestingly, the number of total publications for SARS over time roughly followed the same trend as the number of cases, with an offset by a short time period of less than a month ( Fig. 3 ). Likewise, rapid spikes in the number of cases correspond to slightly offset spikes in the number of publications on SARS by around the same period (16 days).
